entry.title: Pen is good , app is flaky and workflow is terrible.
entry.content:
I bought a livescribe 3 pen and note paper a few weeks ago. The pen works well and the handwriting recognition is great. Unfortunately getting the notes from your device to your computer is cumbersome and requires you to pdf and email each note -also I have noticed about 50% of the time only part of a note is actually saved to the pdf and only when you open the email attachment do you discover this which is very frustrating as this should be a very simple step to get right in comparison to digitising handwriting (which it does well)
Also beware the livescribe pens are advertised as being capable of syncing with your Microsoft email onenote account however this is not the case. It only works if you have a free Microsoft account and not a paid office 365 subscription- get this sorted Livescribe or at least make it obvious in your marketing of this limitation! Overall it’s disappointing having spent £150 on the pen and paper - this device has a great deal of potential but is really let down by a flakey app and limited syncing options.

Pen is good , app is flaky and workflow is terrible.

I bought a livescribe 3 pen and note paper a few weeks ago.
The pen works well and the handwriting recognition is great.
Unfortunately getting the notes from your device to your computer is cumbersome and requires you to pdf and email each note -also I have noticed about 50% of the time only part of a note is actually saved to the pdf and only when you open the email attachment do you discover this which is very frustrating as this should be a very simple step to get right in comparison to digitising handwriting (which it does well)

Also beware the livescribe pens are advertised as being capable of syncing with your Microsoft email onenote account however this is not the case. It only works if you have a free Microsoft account and not a paid office 365 subscription- get this sorted Livescribe or at least make it obvious in your marketing of this limitation!
Overall it’s disappointing having spent £150 on the pen and paper - this device has a great deal of potential but is really let down by a flakey app and limited syncing options.

entry.title: Updated yesterday, not working with pen, current notebooks not loading

entry.title: Has failed again. Livescribe app is weak. Link to Evernote weak, one note no longer works.
entry.content:
Update June 28, 2017 I give up. Have tried resetting pen, repairing, deleting resetting links. All doesn't hold.
Not wasting more of my time on this.
Look for alternatives. I am doing so including tablets that now seem to work very well for handwritten note taking
Too bad.
Update: Feb 4 2017: I have been a user of Anoto technology for years starting with Logitech in the early 2000's and their digital pen. It was the best on the market and nothing has come close.
I have used livescribe for many years starting with an echo and now with their latest Smart3Pen. With this piece of software I was initially able to sync with onenote and that was fine and fairly flexible. That began to fail a few months ago .
I then switched to evernote and was pleased to see it work properly, for about a week.
With online chat support I was able to solve the problem by "deleting" the note book link to evernote and onenote in the livescribe+ app and resyncing it with the corresponding notebook in either.
My tags and annotations were fortunately not lost in the process so I am "happy".
I am not sure how long this will hold until I have to redo it again but it is now doing what it is meant to do.

Has failed again. Livescribe app is weak. Link to Evernote weak, one note no longer works.

Update June 28, 2017
I give up. Have tried resetting pen, repairing, deleting resetting links. All doesn't hold.

Not wasting more of my time on this.

Look for alternatives. I am doing so including tablets that now seem to work very well for handwritten note taking

Too bad.

Update: Feb 4 2017: I have been a user of Anoto technology for years starting with Logitech in the early 2000's and their digital pen. It was the best on the market and nothing has come close.

I have used livescribe for many years starting with an echo and now with their latest Smart3Pen. With this piece of software I was initially able to sync with onenote and that was fine and fairly flexible. That began to fail a few months ago .

I then switched to evernote and was pleased to see it work properly, for about a week.

With online chat support I was able to solve the problem by "deleting" the note book link to evernote and onenote in the livescribe+ app and resyncing it with the corresponding notebook in either.

My tags and annotations were fortunately not lost in the process so I am "happy".

I am not sure how long this will hold until I have to redo it again but it is now doing what it is meant to do.

entry.title: So nearly great
entry.content:
So much better than the Moleskine offering. Pen is great and nice weight. Notebooks are good too and not that dear. However, there are a few things the app really needs:
- the ability to customise tags (there are only three and not much use) - the ability to use a highlighter on the onscreen notes (see Moleskine app) - the ability to export any note as a png/jpg not just sketch notes - the ability to see pages side by side just like the paper notebook - the ability to add new pages and populate them with photos of pages from old paper notebooks so I don't have to re-write them all
Aside from that, really impressed!

So nearly great

So much better than the Moleskine offering. Pen is great and nice weight. Notebooks are good too and not that dear. However, there are a few things the app really needs:

- the ability to customise tags (there are only three and not much use)
- the ability to use a highlighter on the onscreen notes (see Moleskine app)
- the ability to export any note as a png/jpg not just sketch notes
- the ability to see pages side by side just like the paper notebook
- the ability to add new pages and populate them with photos of pages from old paper notebooks so I don't have to re-write them all

Aside from that, really impressed!

entry.title: Mildly horrible software hobbles neat hardware
entry.content:
The livescribe app is mildly horrible. Not so bad that it's completely unusually, but frustrating enough to limit my use of my livescribe 3 pen.
It crashes more often than I'd like, and the page display is unpleasant (why do they scroll like that? Pages should turn over!).
The pen feed is frustrating; it's a good idea, but it can segment pages inconsistently and end up giving me lines of crossed from Ts and dots from Is.
The handwriting recognition's also pretty grim- maybe it's just me, but it gets it wrong more than right and it's a pain to correct. No indication if it becomes more accurate with exposure to your writing.
The tag/star/flag things and the categories don't seem well explained, and I have no idea how they work, so they're not part of my workflow. It'd be nice to be able to make them work, but it's not well explained. Maybe adding some visual indications of tagging on the page display (coloured highlights?) and the feed (e.g. Filter by tag) might make it useful.
I reckon the key use case for transcribing to text in the background is letting you search back through for something you wrote before, which doesn't necessarily need 100% transcription of the text, but seeing what it can read and what it can't would make me more confident using that - maybe a Google Translate style overlay of high-confidence reads with print words would reassure me that the OCR is worth relying on.
Essentially, the Livescribe+ app meets the minimum level of function necessary to make a smartpen work, but misses a lot of chances to capitalise on the hardware. Also it's ugly and it crashes.

Mildly horrible software hobbles neat hardware

The livescribe app is mildly horrible. Not so bad that it's completely unusually, but frustrating enough to limit my use of my livescribe 3 pen.

It crashes more often than I'd like, and the page display is unpleasant (why do they scroll like that? Pages should turn over!).

The pen feed is frustrating; it's a good idea, but it can segment pages inconsistently and end up giving me lines of crossed from Ts and dots from Is.

The handwriting recognition's also pretty grim- maybe it's just me, but it gets it wrong more than right and it's a pain to correct. No indication if it becomes more accurate with exposure to your writing.

The tag/star/flag things and the categories don't seem well explained, and I have no idea how they work, so they're not part of my workflow. It'd be nice to be able to make them work, but it's not well explained. Maybe adding some visual indications of tagging on the page display (coloured highlights?) and the feed (e.g. Filter by tag) might make it useful.

I reckon the key use case for transcribing to text in the background is letting you search back through for something you wrote before, which doesn't necessarily need 100% transcription of the text, but seeing what it can read and what it can't would make me more confident using that - maybe a Google Translate style overlay of high-confidence reads with print words would reassure me that the OCR is worth relying on.

Essentially, the Livescribe+ app meets the minimum level of function necessary to make a smartpen work, but misses a lot of chances to capitalise on the hardware. Also it's ugly and it crashes.

entry.title: Apple Watch Support?!
entry.content:
When l look at the app details in the AppStore I see preview images of an Apple Watch app. However once I download Livescribe+ there is no Apple Watch support. The app doesn't even show up in the Apple Watch app list, so no chance of installing it.
Get more people on the software developing team. The whole internet is bashing this product purely due to its bad software (literally every review I've read). It's a good product but get the IT right!!!

When l look at the app details in the AppStore I see preview images of an Apple Watch app. However once I download Livescribe+ there is no Apple Watch support. The app doesn't even show up in the Apple Watch app list, so no chance of installing it.

entry.title: Extremely basic; poor cloud-based options.
entry.content:
A very basic app, in that it only captures what your LiveScribe pen writes, in black ink. There's no opportunity to change ink colour, and the app does not currently do anything with the numeric symbols (1, 2 & 3) found in the LiveScribe notebooks.
The most annoying feature is that this app provides hardly any feedback apart from the writing. For example, when using the tagging features, it would be nice if the app gave some indication that it had worked, and informed you of exactly what you have just tagged.
The app also tells you nothing about the memory usage on the pen - how do I know when the pen memory is nearly full? What happens then?
It is supposed to auto-sync to Microsoft OneNote, but I couldn't get this to work when logging in with my Office365 details. This is a shame, as I bought the "Pro" version of the pen, for professional use!
It can auto-sync to Evernote, however; it performs a one way sync - my recommendation would be to choose the PDF format.
What's really missing is backup to iCloud, which is a major failing as many iOS users will have an iCloud account.

Extremely basic; poor cloud-based options.

A very basic app, in that it only captures what your LiveScribe pen writes, in black ink. There's no opportunity to change ink colour, and the app does not currently do anything with the numeric symbols (1, 2 & 3) found in the LiveScribe notebooks.

The most annoying feature is that this app provides hardly any feedback apart from the writing. For example, when using the tagging features, it would be nice if the app gave some indication that it had worked, and informed you of exactly what you have just tagged.

The app also tells you nothing about the memory usage on the pen - how do I know when the pen memory is nearly full? What happens then?

It is supposed to auto-sync to Microsoft OneNote, but I couldn't get this to work when logging in with my Office365 details. This is a shame, as I bought the "Pro" version of the pen, for professional use!

It can auto-sync to Evernote, however; it performs a one way sync - my recommendation would be to choose the PDF format.

What's really missing is backup to iCloud, which is a major failing as many iOS users will have an iCloud account.

entry.title: Absolute rubbish
entry.content: The concept is brilliant, and the pen itself is actually quite usable. However the app is simply useless. You can't reliably sync with the pen, pairing notebooks doesn't work, and sending to Evernote is unreliable. I now just use it as a conventional pen and paper, which is obviously a very expensive way of doing that.

Absolute rubbish

The concept is brilliant, and the pen itself is actually quite usable. However the app is simply useless. You can't reliably sync with the pen, pairing notebooks doesn't work, and sending to Evernote is unreliable. I now just use it as a conventional pen and paper, which is obviously a very expensive way of doing that.

entry.title: Serious bug in "Select" function
entry.content: In this version of the software, selection of multiple feed segments converted to editable text does not work properly, making the app unusable for exporting larger chunks of recognised text.

Serious bug in "Select" function

entry.title: Great concept, App is very unstable
entry.content: The overall concept of the Livescribe pen is brilliant; I have long been a fan of digitally archiving my notes and the link with Evernote is first class. The ability to record audio on the pen is also good and sets it apart from other products. However, all of this is compromised by the Livescribe+ app; it's so unstable it crashes and reboots itself more times per day than I care to mention. Speed is also an issue when first opening the app; the three notebooks that I'm currently using take an age to display and uploading 4 or 5 pages of stored text can take upwards of 10 minutes- surely that can't be right? The whole concept of using Livescribe is to make me more efficient; the performance of the app is now impacting on this goal. Please, before introducing any new functionality get this app stable and performing at the level you would expect from a premium product.

Great concept, App is very unstable

The overall concept of the Livescribe pen is brilliant; I have long been a fan of digitally archiving my notes and the link with Evernote is first class. The ability to record audio on the pen is also good and sets it apart from other products. However, all of this is compromised by the Livescribe+ app; it's so unstable it crashes and reboots itself more times per day than I care to mention. Speed is also an issue when first opening the app; the three notebooks that I'm currently using take an age to display and uploading 4 or 5 pages of stored text can take upwards of 10 minutes- surely that can't be right?
The whole concept of using Livescribe is to make me more efficient; the performance of the app is now impacting on this goal. Please, before introducing any new functionality get this app stable and performing at the level you would expect from a premium product.

entry.title: Excellent Update
entry.content:
The added Evernote is much appreciated and the app finally complements the premium subscription added to some versions of the pen.
The app is getting better and better.
Of Note: I lost my notes that we're previously in the app, luckily all were stored on my laptop; nonetheless ensure you have a backup before you update!

Excellent Update

The added Evernote is much appreciated and the app finally complements the premium subscription added to some versions of the pen.

The app is getting better and better.

Of Note: I lost my notes that we're previously in the app, luckily all were stored on my laptop; nonetheless ensure you have a backup before you update!

entry.title: Serious Flaws
entry.content:
I hope potential buyers of Livescribe 3 pens reads this before their purchase and therefore have the chance to reconsider before spending their hard earned cash.
Update: The pen HAD 2big flaws, now 1.
1) The pen is sold with (as stated in the manual) "having ability to customise your own tags in the Livescribe app" but no it cannot. You can assign a tag, a flag and a star. That's it. This is not 'ability to customise a tag' as the whole world knows it or expect it. You cannot assign any specific project names or words, NOTHING. If you have 1000 "snippet" or say 100 pages with tags they would all be listed in the "tag" section. You have no ability to create "project x" tag. This is darn right miss selling.
The second flaw regarding sync with evernote has been rectified via the last update, so I have amended the review to 3 stars.
For us to have a great product we either need the ability to better organise our notes in Livescribe+ (An app which can search your hand writing) by having customisable tags and other improvements in Livescribe. Or Evernote needs to be able to search hand writing like Livescribe+. I recognise the latter option is only in Evernote's control.
As it is, you can either have great organisation but no handwriting search facility. Or a fantastic ability to search handwriting, but really crap organisation (next to zero) of your notes.
I really hope they improve on this because I would love to love this product!

Serious Flaws

I hope potential buyers of Livescribe 3 pens reads this before their purchase and therefore have the chance to reconsider before spending their hard earned cash.

Update: The pen HAD 2big flaws, now 1.

1) The pen is sold with (as stated in the manual) "having ability to customise your own tags in the Livescribe app" but no it cannot. You can assign a tag, a flag and a star. That's it. This is not 'ability to customise a tag' as the whole world knows it or expect it. You cannot assign any specific project names or words, NOTHING. If you have 1000 "snippet" or say 100 pages with tags they would all be listed in the "tag" section. You have no ability to create "project x" tag. This is darn right miss selling.

The second flaw regarding sync with evernote has been rectified via the last update, so I have amended the review to 3 stars.

For us to have a great product we either need the ability to better organise our notes in Livescribe+ (An app which can search your hand writing) by having customisable tags and other improvements in Livescribe. Or Evernote needs to be able to search hand writing like Livescribe+. I recognise the latter option is only in Evernote's control.

As it is, you can either have great organisation but no handwriting search facility. Or a fantastic ability to search handwriting, but really crap organisation (next to zero) of your notes.

I really hope they improve on this because I would love to love this product!

entry.title: Not impressed
entry.content: I love the pen but its not really of much use when the app is so poor and restrictive. I would like to be able to copy pages to One Note so that I can actually do something with my notes and a PDF is simply useless. I also want to be able to move pages and notebooks around to so my notes can be stored in a logical way. I have to say after spending a massive £170 on a great bit of kit, I am so disappointed that the supporting App is of such poor quality. Quite frankly I feel robbed.

entry.title: Great for Mac users
entry.content: No problems - worked straight out of the box on both my iPhone 5c and iPad mini after it had automatically updated its software/firmware. Integration with Mac Pages would be a great help. Have Livescribe thought of allowing it to integrate with a laptop or desktop?

Great for Mac users

No problems - worked straight out of the box on both my iPhone 5c and iPad mini after it had automatically updated its software/firmware. Integration with Mac Pages would be a great help. Have Livescribe thought of allowing it to integrate with a laptop or desktop?

entry.title: App need much improvement
entry.content:
Pen is good by the app needs much improvement.
1) Livescribe PDFs cannot be read on a PC without livescribe player. 2) Pencasts don't allow you to edit the audio subsequent to a recording or to (re)enter the audio at a later time when the pencast writing is playing. 3) Bluetooth transfer is not fast enough and you have often the words leading before the writing.
All this can be fixed with a new released version of the app, but the developers seem to be uninterested in these types of improvements as they have been flagged by the live scribe community since 2012.

App need much improvement

Pen is good by the app needs much improvement.

1) Livescribe PDFs cannot be read on a PC without livescribe player.
2) Pencasts don't allow you to edit the audio subsequent to a recording or to (re)enter the audio at a later time when the pencast writing is playing.
3) Bluetooth transfer is not fast enough and you have often the words leading before the writing.

All this can be fixed with a new released version of the app, but the developers seem to be uninterested in these types of improvements as they have been flagged by the live scribe community since 2012.

entry.title: Functional with limitations
entry.content:
This app is essential for Livescribe 3 smart pen users as it cannot pair with anything else. It captures your scribblings pretty much in realtime - which is pretty cool. If your iPhone is not nearby or has bluetooth off, the pen will cache your writing and sync the next time the app is open with bluetooth switched on. Pretty nifty.
On the downside the Feed screen should have a time stamp for each entry and should allow you to search by strings. This would be a welcomed improvement.
The export is pretty basic and has no direct OCR'd text export to Evernote. You can export a PDF to Evernote or you can OCR your writing then email to your Evernote account. Both not really efficient. Ideally you should be able to export your searchable OCR'd text to Evernote with one click (rather having to labouriously type in your Evernote email address and give it a meaningful subject to allow it to syphon it to the correct Evernote notebook)
Promising - is functional, but ultimately needs a lot more integration with Evernote or at least provide a text search thru your Feed.

Functional with limitations

This app is essential for Livescribe 3 smart pen users as it cannot pair with anything else. It captures your scribblings pretty much in realtime - which is pretty cool. If your iPhone is not nearby or has bluetooth off, the pen will cache your writing and sync the next time the app is open with bluetooth switched on. Pretty nifty.

On the downside the Feed screen should have a time stamp for each entry and should allow you to search by strings. This would be a welcomed improvement.

The export is pretty basic and has no direct OCR'd text export to Evernote. You can export a PDF to Evernote or you can OCR your writing then email to your Evernote account. Both not really efficient. Ideally you should be able to export your searchable OCR'd text to Evernote with one click (rather having to labouriously type in your Evernote email address and give it a meaningful subject to allow it to syphon it to the correct Evernote notebook)

Promising - is functional, but ultimately needs a lot more integration with Evernote or at least provide a text search thru your Feed.

entry.title: Much improved, still lacking...
entry.content: The ability to sync via bluetooth is a much needed upgrade from the previous iterations of the pen. All in all, very good. sync can be a little slow sometimes when you have a few pages to come in all at once. Still lacking in the ability to archive notebooks though. Whilst this isn’t an issue at the moment, It won’t be too long before this will be a hinderance.

Whilst this isn’t an issue at the moment, It won’t be too long before this will be a hinderance.

entry.title: Fantastic
entry.content: The app works as advertised, syncs almost instantaneously with the pen and notes show up with very minimal delay! Very glad also that the bug with syncing along with a pebble smart watch has been fixed!

Fantastic

The app works as advertised, syncs almost instantaneously with the pen and notes show up with very minimal delay! Very glad also that the bug with syncing along with a pebble smart watch has been fixed!

entry.title: Very slick utility
entry.content:
I wouldn't be without my livescribe pens- this is my 3rd as I am always tempted by the improved versions!
This latest innovation increases is functionality immensively. The ease with which it syncs to my ipad and instantly converts handwriting to script is impressive. Wow!
I upload to Evernote, so that all of my stuff is in the same cloud, it all fits together like a dream.

Very slick utility

I wouldn't be without my livescribe pens- this is my 3rd as I am always tempted by the improved versions!

This latest innovation increases is functionality immensively. The ease with which it syncs to my ipad and instantly converts handwriting to script is impressive. Wow!

I upload to Evernote, so that all of my stuff is in the same cloud, it all fits together like a dream.

entry.title: Very impressed
entry.content: As a user of the original Livescribe pen, I’ve always liked the idea. However, the need to sync was always a pain. Now the Livescribe 3 lets me capture notes and access them immediately in the app. The ability to recognise handwriting is very good - and it does an excellent job. The ability to work with the calendar and reminders is a nice feature too. I’d like to see it sync between devices, but otherwise it does all I need.

Very impressed

As a user of the original Livescribe pen, I’ve always liked the idea. However, the need to sync was always a pain. Now the Livescribe 3 lets me capture notes and access them immediately in the app. The ability to recognise handwriting is very good - and it does an excellent job. The ability to work with the calendar and reminders is a nice feature too. I’d like to see it sync between devices, but otherwise it does all I need.

entry.title: Still Crashing
entry.content: Even the latest release crashes when the screen locks, I just lost an hours audio, need a major new release to get this working
